conclusion: Analyzing the motion before and after the string breaks.
Object A experiences a downward force of 10 N.
Object B experiences a force of 6.018 N down the incline.
Object B experiences a normal force perpendicular to the incline.
Net force causing acceleration of the system is 3.982 N.
Acceleration of the system is 1.991 m/s².
Time for object A to hit the ground is 1.002 seconds.
Velocity of object A (and B) at impact is 1.995 m/s.
Object B has traveled 1.662 m along the incline.
Object B is at a position 1.662 m up the incline and has a velocity of 1.995 m/s up the incline.
Acceleration of B after the string breaks is 6.018 m/s² down the incline.
Time for B to stop is 0.332 seconds.
Distance traveled by B during deceleration is 0.331 m.
Total distance from starting point is 1.993 m.
Time for B to return from the highest point is 0.814 seconds.
Total time for B to return to the bottom of the incline is 1.146 seconds.
The time required for object B to return to the bottom of the inclined plane after the string breaks is 1.146 seconds.
